blocks.text: Preventive controls stop an incident before it occurs. Examples include firewalls blocking traffic, access control systems preventing unauthorized logins, and physical locks preventing entry.
Deterrent controls discourage attackers by increasing perceived risk. Examples include warning banners, visible cameras, security signage, and disciplinary policies.
Detective controls identify that an incident has occurred or is occurring. Examples include intrusion detection systems, log monitoring, alarms, and security patrols.
Corrective controls reduce the impact of an incident after it occurs. Examples include restoring from backups, reimaging infected systems, and applying emergency patches.
Compensating controls provide alternative protection when the primary control is not possible. Examples include additional monitoring when a patch is unavailable or extra staff when automation fails.
Directive controls instruct users on proper behavior. Examples include security policies, training programs, and signage directing authorized access only.
